_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Questions asked by the Buddha [sn35.105:: Is the eye permanent or impermanent?
But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?
Is the ear permanent or impermanent?
But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?
Is the nose permanent or impermanent?
But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?
Is the tongue permanent or impermanent?
But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?
Is the body permanent or impermanent?
But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?
Is the mind permanent or impermanent?
But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?
The process of liberation [sn35.105:21.3: Seeing the impermanence and suffering of the six sense bases
Growing disillusioned with the six sense bases
Understanding that rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.
